DASF Toolbox

Submodules

DASF

class dasftoolbox.dasf.DASF(problem: OptimizationProblem, data_retriever: DataRetriever, network_graph: NetworkGraph, dasf_convergence_params: ConvergenceParameters, updating_path: ndarray | None = None, initial_estimate: ndarray | None = None, rng: Generator | None = None, solver_convergence_parameters: ConvergenceParameters | None = None, dynamic_plot: bool = False, dynamic_plot_params: DynamicPlotParameters | None = None)

Bases: object

Base class for the DASF algorithm.

problem

The optimization problem to be solved.

Type:

OptimizationProblem

data_retriever

The data retriever object retrieving data for the optimization problem.

Type:

DataRetriever

network_graph

The network graph representing the sensor network.

Type:

NetworkGraph

dasf_convergence_params

The convergence parameters for the DASF algorithm.

Type:

ConvergenceParameters

updating_path

The path followed to select updating nodes.

Type:

np.ndarray | None

initial_estimate

The initial estimate for the optimization problem.

Type:

np.ndarray | None

rng

Random number generator for reproducibility.

Type:

np.random.Generator | None

solver_convergence_parameters

The convergence parameters of the provided optimization problem. Adds an additional degree of freedom to select different parameters than the ones used by the centralized solver.

Type:

ConvergenceParameters | None

dynamic_plot

Flag to enable dynamic plotting during the algorithm run.

Type:

bool

dynamic_plot_params

Parameters for dynamic plotting.

Type:

DynamicPlotParameters | None

property X_estimate

Final estimate of te optimal solution using DASF

property absolute_objective_error_over_iterations

Returns the sequence |f(X^{i})-f(X^*)|

centralized_solution_for_input(problem_inputs: ProblemInputs | list[ProblemInputs], initial_estimate: ndarray | list[ndarray] | None) → ndarray | list[ndarray]

Solves the centralized problem, used for comparison

get_summary_df() → DataFrame | None

Returns a pandas DataFrame summarizing the simulation results.

property normed_difference_over_iterations

Returns the sequence ||X{i+1}-X^i||_F^2/X.size

property normed_error_over_iterations

Returns the sequence ||X^i-X^*||_F^2/||X^*||_F^2

plot_error() → Figure

Plots the sequence ||X^i-X^*||_F^2/||X^*||_F^2

plot_error_over_batches() → Figure

Plots the sequence ||X^i-X^*||_F^2/||X^*||_F^2 at the end of each batch of data

plot_iterate_difference() → Figure

Plots the sequence ||X{i+1}-X^i||_F^2/X.size

plot_objective_error() → Figure

PLots the sequence |f(X^{i})-f(X^*)|

run() → None

Main method to run the DASF algorithm.

property total_iterations

Returns the number of iterations performed during the run.

class dasftoolbox.dasf.DASFMultiVar(problem: OptimizationProblem, data_retriever: DataRetriever, network_graph: NetworkGraph, dasf_convergence_params: ConvergenceParameters, updating_path: ndarray | None = None, initial_estimate: list[ndarray] | None = None, rng: Generator | None = None, solver_convergence_parameters: ConvergenceParameters | None = None, dynamic_plot: bool = False, dynamic_plot_params: DynamicPlotParameters | None = None)

Bases: DASF

Class inheriting from the DASF class and implementing the DASF algorithm for a setting with multiple variables.

problem

The optimization problem to be solved.

Type:

OptimizationProblem

data_retriever

The data retriever object retrieving data for the optimization problem.

Type:

DataRetriever

network_graph

The network graph representing the sensor network.

Type:

NetworkGraph

dasf_convergence_params

The convergence parameters for the DASF algorithm.

Type:

ConvergenceParameters

updating_path

The path followed to select updating nodes.

Type:

np.ndarray | None

initial_estimate

The list of initial estimates for the optimization problem, one for each variable.

Type:

list[np.ndarray] | None

rng

Random number generator for reproducibility.

Type:

np.random.Generator | None

solver_convergence_parameters

The convergence parameters of the provided optimization problem. Adds an additional degree of freedom to select different parameters than the ones used by the centralized solver.

Type:

ConvergenceParameters | None

dynamic_plot

Flag to enable dynamic plotting during the algorithm run.

Type:

bool

dynamic_plot_params

Parameters for dynamic plotting.

Type:

DynamicPlotParameters | None

property normed_difference_over_iterations

Returns the sequence ||X{i+1}-X^i||_F^2/X.size

property normed_error_over_iterations

Returns the sequence ||X^i-X^*||_F^2/||X^*||_F^2

run() → None

Main method to run the DASF algorithm in a setting with multiple variables.

class dasftoolbox.dasf.DynamicPlotParameters(tau: int = 10, show_x: bool = True, show_xTY: bool = True, X_col: int = 0, XTY_col: int = 0, Y_id: int = 0)

Bases: object

Parameters for dynamic plots.

tau

Sampling period for the dynamic plot.

Type:

int

show_x

Flag to show the current estimate of X, i.e., the filter weights.

Type:

bool

show_xTY

Flag to show the current estimate of X.T @ Y, i.e., the filtered signal, per sample.

Type:

bool

X_col

Index of the column of X (i.e., the filter) to be plotted.

Type:

int

XTY_col

Index of the column of X.T@Y (i.e., the filtered signal) to be plotted for the filtered signal.

Type:

int

XTY_col: int = 0
X_col: int = 0
Y_id: int = 0
apply_correction(nb_filters: int, nb_samples: int) → DynamicPlotParameters

Function ensuring that parameters are set correctly, and making modifications if necessary.

show_x: bool = True
show_xTY: bool = True
tau: int = 10

Optimization Porblems

Optimization Problems

Submodules

class dasftoolbox.optimization_problems.cca_problem.CCAProblem(nb_filters: int)

Bases: OptimizationProblem

evaluate_objective(X: list[ndarray], problem_inputs: list[ProblemInputs]) → float

Evaluate the CCA objective E[trace(X.T @ y(t) @ v(t).T @ W)].

resolve_ambiguity(X_reference: list[ndarray], X_current: list[ndarray], updating_node: int | None = None) → list[ndarray]

Resolve the sign ambiguity for the CCA problem.

solve(problem_inputs: list[ProblemInputs], save_solution: bool = False, convergence_parameters=None, initial_estimate=None) → list[ndarray]

Solve the CCA problem max_(X,W) E[trace(X.T @ y(t) @ v(t).T @ W)] s.t. E[X.T @ y(t) @ y(t).T @ X] = I, E[W.T @ v(t) @ v(t).T @ W] = I.

class dasftoolbox.optimization_problems.gevd_problem.GEVDProblem(nb_filters: int)

Bases: OptimizationProblem

evaluate_objective(X: ndarray, problem_inputs: ProblemInputs) → float

Evaluate the GEVD objective E[||X.T @ y(t)||**2].

resolve_ambiguity(X_reference: ndarray | list[ndarray], X_current: ndarray | list[ndarray], updating_node: int | None = None) → ndarray | list[ndarray]

Resolve the sign ambiguity for the GEVD problem.

solve(problem_inputs: ProblemInputs, save_solution: bool = False, convergence_parameters=None, initial_estimate=None) → ndarray

Solve the GEVD problem max E[||X.T @ y(t)||**2] s.t. E[X.T @ v(t) @ v(t).T @ X] = I.

class dasftoolbox.optimization_problems.optimization_problem.OptimizationProblem(nb_filters: int, convergence_parameters: ConvergenceParameters | None = None, initial_estimate: ndarray | list[ndarray] | None = None, rng: Generator | None = None, nb_variables: int = 1)

Bases: ABC

property X_star

Property to get the optimal solution of the optimization problem. :returns: Optimal solution. :rtype: np.ndarray | list[np.ndarray]

abstractmethod evaluate_objective(X: ndarray | list[ndarray], problem_inputs: ProblemInputs | list[ProblemInputs]) → float

Method to evaluate the objective function of the optimization problem. :param X: Point to evaluate. :type X: np.ndarray | list[np.ndarray] :param problem_inputs: Problem inputs. :type problem_inputs: ProblemInputs | list[ProblemInputs]

Returns:

Objective function value.

Return type:

float

resolve_ambiguity(X_reference: ndarray | list[ndarray], X_current: ndarray | list[ndarray], updating_node: int | None = None) → ndarray | list[ndarray]

Method to resolve the ambiguity in the optimization problem. :param X_reference: Reference solution. :type X_reference: np.ndarray | list[np.ndarray] :param X_current: Current solution. :type X_current: np.ndarray | list[np.ndarray] :param updating_node: Updating node, for more flexibility. Defaults to None. :type updating_node: int, optional

Returns:

Resolved solution.

Return type:

np.ndarray | list[np.ndarray]

abstractmethod solve(problem_inputs: ProblemInputs | list[ProblemInputs], save_solution: bool = False, convergence_parameters: ConvergenceParameters | None = None, initial_estimate: ndarray | list[ndarray] | None = None) → ndarray | list[ndarray]

Method to solve the optimization problem. :param problem_inputs: Problem inputs for the optimization. :type problem_inputs: ProblemInputs | list[ProblemInputs] :param save_solution: Whether to save the solution. Defaults to False. :type save_solution: bool, optional :param convergence_parameters: Convergence parameters for the optimization. Defaults to None. :type convergence_parameters: ConvergenceParameters | None, optional :param initial_estimate: Initial estimate for the optimization. Defaults to None. :type initial_estimate: np.ndarray | list[np.ndarray] | None, optional

Returns:

Solution to the optimization problem.

Return type:

np.ndarray | list[np.ndarray]

class dasftoolbox.optimization_problems.qcqp_problem.QCQPProblem(nb_filters: int)

Bases: OptimizationProblem

evaluate_objective(X: ndarray, problem_inputs: ProblemInputs) → float

Evaluate the QCQP objective 0.5 * E[||X.T @ y(t)||**2] - trace(X.T @ B).

solve(problem_inputs: ProblemInputs, save_solution: bool = False, convergence_parameters=None, initial_estimate=None) → ndarray

Solve the QCQP problem min 0.5 * E[||X.T @ y(t)||**2] - trace(X.T @ B) s.t. trace(X.T @ Gamma @ X) <= alpha**2; X.T @ c = d.

class dasftoolbox.optimization_problems.rtls_problem.RTLSProblem(nb_filters: int, convergence_parameters: ConvergenceParameters, initial_estimate: ndarray | None = None)

Bases: OptimizationProblem

evaluate_objective(X: ndarray, problem_inputs: ProblemInputs) → float

Evaluate the RTLS objective E[|X.T @ y(t) - d(t)|**2] / (1 + X.T @ Gamma @ X).

solve(problem_inputs: ProblemInputs, save_solution: bool = False, convergence_parameters=None, initial_estimate=None) → ndarray

Solve the RTLS problem max rho = E[|X.T @ y(t) - d(t)|**2] / (1 + X.T @ X) s.t. ||X.T @ L|| <= delta ** 2.

class dasftoolbox.optimization_problems.tro_problem.TROProblem(nb_filters: int, convergence_parameters: ConvergenceParameters)

Bases: OptimizationProblem

evaluate_objective(X: ndarray, problem_inputs: ProblemInputs) → float

Evaluate the TRO objective E[||X.T @ y(t)||**2] / E[||X.T @ v(t)||**2].

resolve_ambiguity(X_reference: ndarray | list[ndarray], X_current: ndarray | list[ndarray], updating_node: int | None = None) → ndarray | list[ndarray]

Resolve the sign ambiguity for the TRO problem.

solve(problem_inputs: ProblemInputs, save_solution: bool = False, convergence_parameters=None, initial_estimate=None) → ndarray

Solve the TRO problem max E[||X.T @ y(t)||**2] / E[||X.T @ v(t)||**2] s.t. X.T @ Gamma @ X = I.

Module contents

Problem settings

class dasftoolbox.problem_settings.ConvergenceParameters(max_iterations: int | None = None, objective_tolerance: float | None = None, argument_tolerance: float | None = None)

Bases: object

Class storing the convergence parameters of an optimization problem. This class is used both by the centralized solver and the DASF solver.

max_iterations

Maximum number of iterations the solver applies.

Type:

int | None

objective_tolerance

Threshold for two consecutive objective function values. If the absolute difference is below this value, the solver stops.

Type:

float | None

argument_tolerance

Threshold for two consecutive iterates. If the norm of the difference is below this value, the solver stops.

Type:

float | None

argument_tolerance: float | None = None
max_iterations: int | None = None
objective_tolerance: float | None = None
class dasftoolbox.problem_settings.NetworkGraph(nb_nodes: int, nb_sensors_per_node: ndarray, adjacency_matrix: ndarray)

Bases: object

Class storing the properties of the network graph.

nb_nodes

Number of nodes in the network.

Type:

int

nb_sensors_per_node

Array storing the number of sensors per node in the network.

Type:

np.ndarray

adjacency_matrix

Adjacency matrix of the network.

Type:

np.ndarray

nb_sensors_total

Total number of sensors in the network.

Type:

int

plot_graph() → None

Plots the adjacency matrix and the graph of the network.

class dasftoolbox.problem_settings.ProblemInputs(fused_signals: list[ndarray], fused_constants: list[ndarray] | None = None, fused_quadratics: list[ndarray] | None = None, global_parameters: list[ndarray] | None = None)

Bases: object

Class storing the inputs, i.e., the data, of the problem.

fused_signals

List of signals to be fused by the variable.

Type:

list[np.ndarray]

fused_constants

List of constant arrays to be fused by the variable. Similar to the signals, but do not change in time.

Type:

list[np.ndarray] | None = None

fused_quadratics

List of block-diagonal arrays to be fused by the variable from both sides, e.g., X.T @ M @ X.

Type:

list[np.ndarray] | None = None

global_parameters

List of arrays that are not fused by the variable, but are needed to solve the optimization problem.

Type:

list[np.ndarray] | None = None
